ygData.messageBody:
Been thinking that the warrior class needs a "critical hit" skill. Being the superior combatant that I am, and after all the battles against so many differing kinds of opponents I have learned how and where to hit creatures to do the most damage.

Instead of slashing randomly at that hill giant I want to deftly stick my blade in where it will do the most damage. I think that having a skill like this that causes double damage on a successful skill check would go great lengths to improving our class.

Comments? This is something that I think Verant might listen to. THe skill could be implemented around level 18 or so. This is about the time I think when warriors suddenly become the damage-absorbing portion of a party and less of a damage causing part. I don't know yet because I am level 16, but I am finding that I am resorting to large numbers of attacks to do damage, because with fewer attacks I don't hit often enough to really solo anything but really small blues.

Currently I am using a tentacle whip as primary and combine scimitar as secondary.

For reference. You may recall that I had started a ranger about 3 weeks ago. I have been playing with that character more than my warrior because I wanted to compare capabilities at the same level. My ranger uses a 2 handed dwarven axe (great weapon by the way, 14 damage 43 delay), and sometimes a 1 handed dwarven axe. He is at level 15. I can solo any blue, many yellows and i have even soloed a few red orc slavers. In comparison my warrior, level 16 is beaten to the point of 10 minute resting after a fight by most blues. He runs from anything that is yellow or red.

In a group the ranger meets all the same party needs as a warrior plus he provides his own healing and buffing. My 16th level warrior is about to get a fine steel 2 handed sword and work up his 2hs skill to a comparable level as the ranger. We will see how that goes.

The warrior formerly known as Bael

Now one of those weenie wood elf rangers, Aelyn.

OK....I may be going off the main opinion on this, but I don't want to see warriors casting spells! Warriors are the "I don't give a damn who you are....I'm going to kill you," type and using magic would just be wussy. If you want to use magic go be a paladin or a ranger, or even a shadow night. ALL the points in that post were right on. I am nowhere close to level 40-something, but I can see my warrior getting steadily worse as I rarely even get a hit in before a caster brings the baddie down. I start to question...."Why the hell am I even with this group?" People who form groups try to keep them balanced, (I have found that 9 of 10 times it is a caster forming the group) and so they look for a warrior as well as a bard, cleric....but why the warrior? To tank? Of course, but who wants to just stand there getting hit? The main mentality of a warrior is honor on the battlefield. To me in this game the warrior class is anything but honorable. "Ok buddy....you just stand there while I hit him with all kinds of magic from over here ok?" NO THAT IS NOT OK. I want to be the one to kill it! Hell, I want to kill everything! But guess what? At level 15 I can't even solo anymore. WTF??!? A warrior should just be a complete killing machine. I'll make a reference here....Before I do, let me tell you that I have been playing AD&D games for about 15 years and have been in the RPGA for about 10. For those of you who know the Forgoten Realms (Which I am sure most of you do) you know that there is not really much difference between a Fighter and a Ranger. The ranger is more like a fighter who likes the outdoors, and at higher level gets a couple of tree-helping spells. Anyways.....for those of you who know...look at Drizzt Do'Urden. 20-something level ranger. Look at how much he kicks ass...he could take out giants, golems...pretty much anything. His blades are a dance of death. Now...put him in norrath. He has dual wield. So what. He has a super high agility. And? He could take out a hill giant and not even get touched! Umm...not so fast. Even at level 40+ I think PCs have trouble taking out a hill giant, and if anyone CAN solo one....does it even make it worth it? Is there ANY xp given? I too am fed up with that 'warrior' class. They should just change the name of it to 'Bag' or something. You get weapons until you are sufficiently high enough level to become and efficient punching bag, doing your part to help. Damn that. I want my job description to be "You can use whatever the hell you want to kill whatever you can. If something is bigger than you, just swing harder. Arm yourself well and protect yourself with the best armor you can so that you become a well oiled, living, breathing killing machine." That is the job I singed up for. That is the job I want. Nuff said.

Jynxx
